title: Andy Cohen showers his son Benjamin with affection as he joyfully lifts his child into the air
text:
He has been inseparable from his baby boy ever since welcoming him into the world via surrogate last year eight months ago.

Andy Cohen and his son Benjamin were looking like the best of friends during another day of father-son bonding on Saturday.

The Bravo star, 51, was every inch the adoring papa as he joyfully lifted his tot high into the air, while waiting outside King Of Cutz barbershop.

That's his boy! Andy Cohen and his son Benjamin were looking like the best of friends during another day of father-son bonding in New York on Saturday

As Andy raised his child into the air, the youngster smiled back at his father.

The TV star looked every inch the adoring father while holding the youngster close.

Andy just could not stop smiling while enjoying the sunny day with Benjamin.

At one point, the devoted dad took his youngster to the Statue Of Liberty.

Aww! Cohen couldn't have looked happier as he raised his gleeful son into the air

Happy days: Cohen couldn't stop smiling during his outing with his son

Andy took to Instagram to mark the special occasion, and shared a snap of himself triumphantly lifting Benjamin into the air in front of the historic artwork.

He captioned the photo with a trio of Statue Of Liberty emojis.

Ever since welcoming Benjamin into the world, Andy has been posting non-stop photos of the youngster onto his Instagram account.

The apple of his eye: The Bravo star smiled from ear-to-ear at his cherubic son

Aww: The Watch What Happens Live host welcomed Benjamin via surrogate nearly a year ago

The Watch What Happens Live host welcomed Benjamin via surrogate nearly a year ago.

The Bravo star reflected on meeting his baby boy for the first time in the delivery room.

'I had been hoping that he would have a full head of hair, and he really over-delivered,' the star joked to People.

'That was the first thing you see, the head of hair coming out,' the openly gay TV host and producer said. 'And I was amazed.'
